title: What People Do for a Happy New Year

content.en: Happy New Year! There are many New Year's traditions. You know some of them. There's fireworks and kissing someone at midnight on New Year's Eve. There are many more. Some of them are surprising!
content.tw: 新年快樂! 新年有很多不同的習俗，像是放煙火或是在跨年的時候互相親吻。

content.en: In Europe, some people throw out sofas or other furniture at midnight on New Year's Eve. Watch out!! They throw the furniture out of their windows! Why do they do this? It's a way to throw away old things and welcome new things.
content.tw: 歐洲有很多人會在跨年夜丟掉家具除舊布新，注意喔! 是直接丟出窗外。

content.en: In some places, people leave their doors and windows open. Again, this is to let old things out and welcome the New Year. Doing this can be cold, especially when it's windy!
content.tw: 有一些地方人們會打開門窗歡迎新年的到來。

content.en: In Spain, some people walk around with an empty suitcase on New Year's Eve. They think it helps them travel more. Maybe they will go on trips to fun places!
content.tw: 西班牙有人會在跨年夜拿著空行李箱到處走，他們相信這樣也許會旅行到好玩的地方。

content.en: In the Philippines, people jump into the air at midnight on New Year's Eve. They think this helps them grow taller!
content.tw: 菲律賓人覺得跨年的時候跳得越高，可以長得越高。

content.en: There are many interesting New Year's traditions. Do you want to try some of these traditions? What are your traditions?
content.tw: 新年有很多有趣的習俗。你想嘗試這些習俗中的一些嗎？你的習俗是什麼？

vocabulary.preface: 過新年的習俗百百種，每個地方不同。

content.text:
1. jump 跳
What are you doing, Jacob? 你在做什麼，傑可?
Can't you see that I'm jumping? 你看不出來我在跳嗎?
Yeah, but what for? 看得出，但是幹嘛要跳?

2. taller 比較高的
For helping me to grow taller. 可以幫我再長高一點兒。
You are too old to grow taller! 你太老，不會再長了。
Ouch, that hurts. 很傷人喔。

3. windy 颳風的
And it's windy outside. 而且外面風好大。
You should come into the house. 你應該進屋子裡來。

4. window 窗戶
It IS windy! 風真的很大!
Let me close the windows. 讓我把窗子關起來。
There, much better. 好了，好多了。
Now I need to sit down. All that jumping is tiring!
現在我得坐下。那樣蹦蹦跳很累喔!

vocabulary.postscript:
Let's learn more English in 2024! 來讀單字吧。
jump跳
taller比較高的
windy颳風的
window窗戶

quiz.question: 1. Why do people throw furniture out the window?
2. In Spain, what do some people walk around with?
3. Where do people jump in the air to grow taller?

content.en: Hotpot is great fun. Everyone cooks together! And hotpot is traditional. Taiwanese families eat hotpot on Lunar New Year's Eve for good luck.
content.tw: 吃火鍋很有趣，也是一種傳統。台灣家庭會在農曆新年圍爐吃火鍋。

content.en: Hotpot changes everywhere you go. Thailand, Japan, Cambodia, and Laos have their own kinds of hotpot. Switzerland has a kind of hotpot too, made with cheese! And China has two kinds of hotpot, one from the north and one from the south.
content.tw: 各地的火鍋都不一樣。泰國、日本、柬埔寨跟寮國都有自己的特色火鍋。瑞士有起司鍋。中國也分南方火鍋跟北方火鍋。

content.en: Ms. Kong lives in China. She doesn't like hotpot… She loves it! Ms. Kong loves hotpot very much. She likes to eat hotpot at one hotpot restaurant. She went 627 times in nine years!
content.tw: 孔小姐很愛在同一間火鍋餐廳吃火鍋，九年她一共去了627次。

content.en: Eating hotpot is Ms. Kong's hobby. She doesn't have any other hobbies. She doesn't like to cook. She likes to eat! And she likes to eat hotpot the most.
content.tw: 吃火鍋是她唯一的嗜好，她不喜歡煮但很喜歡吃，也最喜歡吃火鍋。

content.en: Eating so much hotpot is not healthy. And hotpot cost Ms. Kong a lot of money. She spent 270,000 yuan on hotpot. That's more than a million Taiwan dollars!
content.tw: 吃太多火鍋對身體不好，而孔小姐總共花了27萬人民幣吃火鍋，超過台幣100萬。

content.en: No more hotpot, Ms. Kong! Take care of your health and your money!
content.tw: 孔小姐，別再吃火鍋了！請照顧好你的健康和金錢！

vocabulary.preface: 這名女士會不會吃太多火鍋了?

content.text: 1. traditional 傳統的 Let's eat traditional hotpot tonight. 我們今晚吃個傳統火鍋吧。 What's that? 那是什麼呢? It's a brass pot with a chimney. 就是有個煙囪的黃銅火鍋。
2. healthy 健康的 Oh, I know that one. 我知道那種。 But what's so special about it? 但是有什麼特別的? I heard it's healthier. 聽說比較健康。 That's not true.不是真的吧。
3. spend 花費 Cooking it ourselves would be healthier.自己煮才會比較健康。 Okay, I'll buy vegetables and meat this afternoon. 好吧，那我今天下午去買菜跟肉。 Don't spend too much money, though.但是不要花太多錢。
4. more than 比較多 I won't spend more than 1,000 NT. 我不會花超過一千塊。 I'm running out of money! 我快沒錢了。

vocabulary.postscript: 你喜歡火鍋嗎?來一起讀單字。 traditional傳統的 healthy健康的 spend花費 more than比較多

quiz.question: 1. What is hotpot made with in Switzerland?
2. Where did Ms. Kong eat hotpot 627 times?
3. How much is 270,000 yuan in Taiwan dollars?

title: Big Search Fails to Find Monster

content.en: Are monsters real? There's Nian during the Lunar New Year. Nian has a lion's face with sharp teeth. People say this monster eats people and animals! But don't worry, Nian isn't real.
content.tw: 真的有怪獸嗎? 農曆新年有年獸。牠有?獅子的臉跟尖牙。大家都說年獸會吃人跟動物，但別擔心，年獸不是真的。

content.en: How about the Loch Ness Monster? Many people think it's real. They think it lives in Scotland, in Loch Ness. "Loch" means lake.
content.tw: 那尼斯湖水怪呢? 很多人覺得牠是真的，住在蘇格蘭尼斯湖。"Loch"是指湖。

content.en: People think the Loch Ness Monster looks like a dinosaur. Some say it has humps.
content.tw: 大家覺得尼斯湖水怪看起來像一隻恐龍，說牠有背部隆起的身形。

content.en: Camels have humps, too. Camels are real. Is the Loch Ness Monster real? Nobody knows. But people have tried to find Nessie for a long time. Nessie? That's the monster's nickname.
content.tw: 駱駝背部也有駝峰，駱駝是真的。但尼湖水怪是真的嗎？沒有人知道，大家試著找Nessie好久了。Nessie是牠的小名。

content.en: In 2023, more than 300 people searched for Nessie in the loch. They looked together for two days. People put cameras and microphones in the water. They used drones. It was the biggest search for Nessie in 50 years! Some people took pictures of a big shadow in the water. Some people said they saw humps in the water. But no one found Nessie. What do you think? Is the Loch Ness Monster a real monster?
content.tw: 2023年，超過300人在湖中搜尋尼斯水怪。他們一起尋找了兩天。人們將攝影機和麥克風放入水中。他們使用了無人機。這是50年來最大規模的尼斯水怪搜尋！有些人拍到了水中巨大陰影的照片。有些人說他們看到水中有駝峰。但沒有人找到尼斯水怪。你覺得呢？尼斯湖水怪是真的怪物嗎？

vocabulary.preface: 一大群人費盡力氣，希望解開尼斯湖水怪的謎。

content.text:
1. nobody 沒有人
I've never seen a monster. 我從來沒看過怪物。
Me neither. Nobody has, I believe. 我也沒有。我相信沒有人看過。
Monsters only exist in stories. 怪物只存在故事裡面。

2. look for 尋找
Really? Then why are people looking for them? 真的嗎? 那為什麼大家要找怪物?
Like in Loch Ness? 像尼斯湖那樣嗎?
They must be scientists. 他們一定是科學家。

3. microphone 麥克風
No, they were ordinary people. 不是，他們是普通人。
One dropped a microphone into the water to collect sounds.

4. find 發現、找到
Did he find anything? 他有什麼發現嗎?
No. I think the monster is gone. 沒有，我覺得怪物已經走了。

vocabulary.postscript:
你今天學到哪些單字?
nobody沒有人
look for尋找
microphone麥克風
find發現、找到

quiz.question: 1. How many people looked for the Loch Ness Monster in 2023?
2. What is the Loch Ness Monster's nickname?
3. What did people see in Loch Ness in 2023?

content.en: Let's have a quick quiz! Listen: what's this?
content.tw: 我們來玩個小測驗！聽聽看這是什麼？

content.en: This sound is a sonic boom. It happens when something moves faster than the speed of sound!
content.tw: 這是聲爆，當物體移動的速度比聲音快就會發生聲爆。

content.en: Sound moves very fast through the air. Airplanes do too. The fastest airplanes are jets. Some jets fly faster than sound! They're supersonic jets.
content.tw: 聲音在空氣中傳得很快，飛機也是這樣。最快的飛機是噴射機，超音速噴射機比聲音還要快。

content.en: One of the most famous supersonic jets was the Concorde. Most airplanes take seven hours to fly from London to New York. The Concorde did it in three and a half hours!
content.tw: 最有名的超音速噴射機是協和號客機，協和號只需要花三個半小時就可以從倫敦飛到紐約，是普通噴射機的一半。

content.en: One problem with the Concorde was the sonic boom. It was too loud! People didn't like it.
content.tw: 協和號其中的一個問題是聲爆太吵了，大家不喜歡。

content.en: NASA is the space agency of the USA. Now, NASA is making a new, very quiet supersonic jet! It's called the X-59.
content.tw: 美國太空總署正在製造新型的超音速噴射機，聲音很小，叫做 X-59。

content.en: NASA says the X-59 can fly from New York to London in one and a half hours! That's much faster than the Concorde! And the sonic boom is now a little sonic thump.
content.tw: 美國太空總署表示，X-59 可以在一個半小時內從紐約飛到倫敦！這比協和號快得多！而且聲爆現在變成輕微的聲響。

content.en: The X-59 is a new start for much faster, much quieter flights!
content.tw: X-59 為更快、更安靜的飛行開啟了新的篇章！

vocabulary.preface: 超音速噴射機的聲音太吵，美國太空總署正在改善。

content.text:
1. fast 快的
Wow, that was fast! 哇，飛得好快!
Yeah, so cool! 對啊，好酷 !
What kind of fighter jets are they? 那是哪一種噴射戰機?
I think they're F-16. 我想是F-16.

2. airplane 飛機
They're so much faster than an airplane.
它們比飛機快多了。
It's because they're much smaller. 因為它小很多.

3. supersonic 超音速
They can go supersonic as well.它們也可以超音速飛行。
I hope they do that now. 我希望它們現在就那樣飛。
I can't wait for the sonic boom. 我等不及要聽聲爆了.

4. loud 大聲的
It'll be so loud that you have to cover your ears. 那聲音會大到你得遮住耳朵。
Really? How exciting! 真的嗎? 好興奮!

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字很有趣。
fast快的
airplane飛機
supersonic超音速
loud大聲的

quiz.question: 1. What happens when something moves faster than sound?
2. What kind of airplane was the Concorde?
3. In how many hours can the X-59 fly from New York to London?
options: b. Three and a half hours
c. One and a half hours

title: Big Iceberg Floats and Feeds the Ocean

content.en: What is A23a? It’s two times bigger than New Taipei City. It's almost as tall as Taipei 101!
content.tw: 什麼是A23a? 它比新北市還大兩倍，跟台北101一樣高。

content.en: A23a is an iceberg! That's a mountain of ice. Most of it is underwater. It's very heavy. But it floats in the ocean, the same as an ice cube in your milk tea!
content.tw: A23a是一座冰山。冰山有一大部分沉在水裡，而且很重。但是它可以漂在海面上。

content.en: A23a is the biggest iceberg in the world now. Ocean waves push it and it moves... very, very slowly...
content.tw: A23a是現今世界上最大的冰山。它隨著洋流緩慢地移動。

content.en: As years go by, the iceberg slowly melts and gives nutrients to the ocean.
content.tw: 幾年過去了，這座冰山的養分慢慢溶到海裡。

content.en: The nutrients help very, very small plants grow. Small ocean animals eat these plants and grow! Then bigger ocean animals eat the smaller ones. Then... this goes on and on!
content.tw: 這些養分幫助很小的植物生長，小型的海生動物吃這些植物，再被大一點的動物吃掉，以此類推。

content.en: Waves are pushing A23a to Iceberg Alley, an ocean path where many icebergs are. Then it will melt away in the Atlantic Ocean…
content.tw: 洋流把A23a推到冰山巷，很多冰山都被推向那裡，之後會在大西洋慢慢地融化。

content.en: Icebergs make the ocean healthy, yes... But now, there are more and more icebergs. They're melting faster. This shows our Earth is too hot. Let's cool the Earth!
content.tw: 冰山確實讓海洋保持健康... 但現在，冰山越來越多，而且融化得更快。這表示我們的地球太熱了。讓我們一起為地球降溫吧！

vocabulary.preface: 世界最大的冰山慢慢融解，同時也滋養著海洋生物。

content.text:
1. melt 融化
Are you staring at your drink? 你是在瞪著你的飲料嗎?

1. slowly 慢慢地
Why are you interested in that? 為什麼你對那個有興趣呢?
Because it’s getting smaller very slowly now. 因為它現在很慢地變小。Sometimes it melts very fast. 有時候它很快就融了。

1. ocean 海洋
It melts fast if the drink is hot. 要是飲料是熱的，它很快就會融化。
Just like an iceberg. 就像冰山一樣。
If the ocean water is warm, it’ll disappear quickly. 要是海水溫暖，它很快就會不見。

1. milk tea 奶茶
All this talk about ice makes me want a milk tea. 這個冰塊話題讓我想喝奶茶。
I love milk tea! 我很喜歡奶茶!

vocabulary.postscript:
melt融化
slowly慢慢地
ocean海洋
milk tea奶茶

quiz.question: 1. What does A23a give as it melts?
1. What is NOT true about A23a?
1. What pushes A23a?

content.en: Narrator: Let's go jogging. We're so full of energy!
Electricity is full of energy too. It moves. Think of water flowing in a river. That's how electricity moves.
content.tw: 電力充滿能量，電力流動的方式就像水在河裡流動一樣。

content.en: Circuits start and end in the same place. Running tracks are circuits. Hey … let's jog on a circuit! We can jog around and around and around… Circuits help electricity flow safely around and around.
content.tw: Circuit指的是環形的路線，像是操場跑道。Electric circuits則是電路，讓電流穩定流動。

content.en: Electric particles: Oh, there's a shorter way to go! Let's take it!

Narrator: When electricity finds a shorter way to go, it takes it. This is called a short circuit. Short circuits can be very dangerous. They make electricity flow faster! This makes lots of heat. Too much heat can start a fire!
content.tw: 當電力找到更短的路線的時候，就會發生短路，導致過熱而電線走火。

content.en: Anything electric can short circuit… Smart toilets can!
content.tw: 任何電器都有可能短路，智慧馬桶也會喔!

content.en: Thanks to electricity, smart toilets have nice, warm seats. Smart toilets wash your bottom. Some dry it too. Some can play your favorite songs! In China, a smart toilet short-circuited. It started a big fire! A man was surprised... but not hurt.
content.tw: 智慧馬桶因為電力可以暖座、沖洗、烘乾，甚至可以播放你喜歡的歌。在中國，有個智慧馬桶因為短路而燒了起來，幸好沒有人受傷。

content.en: But don't worry. Short circuits in smart toilets almost never happen. This toilet wasn't so smart, was it!
content.tw: 不過別擔心，智慧馬桶短路的情況幾乎從未發生。這個馬桶沒有那麼聰明，不是嗎！

vocabulary.preface: 電力對現代人來說太重要了，但是也會有出錯的時候。

content.text:
1. go jogging 去慢跑
I’m going jogging tonight. 我今晚要去慢跑。
At the stadium? 在體育場嗎?
Yeah, would you like to come along? 對，你想一起來嗎?
No, too many people. 不了，人太多。

2. around 環繞
Besides, it’s not fun. 而且不好玩。
You’re just running around and around. 你就是一圈又一圈地跑。
You can listen to music when running.你可以在跑步的時候聽音樂啊。

3. short 短的
Even a short run of 15 minutes would be good for you, you know.
即使只跑短短15分鐘也對你有益，你知道嗎。

4. energy 精力
No, it takes too much energy. 不要，太花力氣了。
I just want to stay nice and warm at home.我只想舒舒服服又暖和的待在家。

vocabulary.postscript:
請注意，來讀今天的單字。
go jogging去慢跑
around環繞
short短的
energy精力

quiz.question: 1. What helps electricity flow safely?
2. What can too much heat start?
3. What can short-circuit?

content.en: People in Sweden made a flying ferryboat! Wait... what's a ferryboat?
content.tw: 瑞典人發明了一艘飛行渡輪！等等…什麼是渡輪？

content.en: Ferryboats are buses on water. They carry many people. People use them to go to work or school. Some ferries carry cars too.
content.tw: Ferryboat渡輪就像水上的公車，載人上班、上學，也可以載車子。

content.en: Ferries need to push lots of water so they can move. That takes a lot of energy. All that water makes ferries slow. It also makes ferries move side to side and up and down. Many people feel seasick.
content.tw: 渡輪需要很大的動力才能往前走。水流會讓渡輪的速度變慢，也會搖晃。很多人會因此暈船。

content.en: The flying ferry from Sweden can carry thirty people. It doesn't carry cars. It starts in the water. Then it flies close above the water!
content.tw: 瑞典的飛行渡輪可以搭載30個人，它不載車子。它從海上起飛並在海面上飛行。

content.en: This flying ferry doesn't need to push water to move, so it doesn't use a lot of energy. It's very fast. And it doesn't move side to side or up and down. People don't get seasick.
content.tw: 這艘飛行渡輪速度非常快，而且不需要消耗很多的動力，也不會搖晃。

content.en: And this ferry is electric! That helps the Earth. Electricity costs ninety percent less than the fuel for other ferries. What a huge saving! That helps ferry companies.
content.tw: 這艘渡輪是電動的！電力的花費比燃油便宜九成，所以電動飛行渡輪幫助地球也幫助渡輪公司。

content.en: Electric flying ferries are good for people, ferry companies, and the Earth! Can we have them in Taiwan?
content.tw: 電動飛行渡輪對人類、渡輪公司和地球都有益處！我們在台灣也能擁有它們嗎？

vocabulary.preface: 瑞典的飛行渡輪解決了許多問題。

content.text: 1. seasick 暈船 A flying ferryboat. 一艘飛行渡輪。 What a good idea! 好棒的主意! Yeah, I've never liked taking boats. 對啊，我從來就不愛搭船。 They make me feel seasick. 會讓我暈船。
2. carry 搭載 But this one seems different. 但是這艘好像不一樣。 I just hope it can carry my bike, too. 我只希望它也能載腳踏車。
3. need 需要 Why do you need your bike? 為什麼需要腳踏車? I need it to go to school. 我需要騎車上學啊。
4. water 水 It lands on water… 它降落在水上... So how do you ride your bike? 所以你要怎麼騎車? It should get close to a dock. 它應該會靠碼頭。 Then I can ride it down the ramp. 然後我就可以騎車下坡道。

vocabulary.postscript: 你有搭過渡輪嗎? 來讀單字。 seasick暈船 carry搭載 need需要 water水

quiz.question: 1. What does the flying ferry carry?
2. What is good about the flying ferry?
options: b. It moves side to side.

quiz.question: 3. What makes the flying ferry fly?

content.en: Doctors are always finding new ways to help people. Now, for the first time ever, they've given someone a new eye! His name is Aaron …
content.tw: 醫生有史以來第一次成功移植一顆新的眼球給一個叫作Aaron的人。

content.en: Aaron works with electricity. Electricity is full of power. It's made in power stations. Power lines take electricity to our homes.
content.tw: Aaron在電力公司上班。發電廠生產電，電線再將電傳送到家庭。

content.en: One power line takes electricity to many homes. Touching a power line is very dangerous! So power lines are high above the ground. This keeps people safe.
content.tw: 電線傳送電力到不同的家庭。碰觸電線很危險，所以電線都在高處防止人家不小心被電到。

content.en: Aaron's job was fixing power lines. One day, he touched a power line. It was an accident. Aaron got a big, bad shock! Seven thousand two hundred volts hit his body. That's electricity for 30 houses!
content.tw: Aaron 有一天修理電線的時候，遭到7200伏特的高壓電擊中，相當於30間房屋的用電量。

content.en: Aaron almost died! Half of his face was gone! One of Aaron's eyes was gone too. Aaron took a selfie. He saw inside his skull!
content.tw: Aaron 差一點死掉，他不僅半張臉毀容，也失去了一隻眼睛。

content.en: One hundred forty doctors and nurses worked 21 hours in one day to help Aaron. They saved his life! And, they gave him a new eye too!
content.tw: 140位醫生跟護士花了21個小時，救了他的性命，也給他一顆新的眼球。

content.en: A team of over 100 doctors and nurses saved Aaron's life, and his eye!
content.tw: 一個由超過100名醫生和護士組成的團隊拯救了亞倫的生命和他的眼睛！

vocabulary.preface: Aaron雖然身受重傷，在醫護人員全力搶救之下撿回一條命。

content.text:
1. power 電力
Oh no, the power's out! 糟糕，停電了!
Get the candles! 快去拿蠟燭。
No, you have your cell phone, remember? 不用啦，你記得你有手機吧?
But without electricity, my cell phone won't last long.但是停電，我的手機也維持不了多久。

2. fix 修理
Maybe they can fix the power line fast. 也許他們很快就會把電線修好。
No, I don't want people to go out in this weather.
不，我不要人們在這種天氣出門。

3. dangerous 危險的
It's too dangerous. 太危險了。
That's true. 那是真的。
You're right. 你說得對。
We don't want accidents.我們不想要出什麼事。

4. help 幫忙
I'll get the candles then. 我去拿蠟燭。
And I can help cook dinner. 我可以幫忙做晚飯。

vocabulary.postscript:
你的家裡有停電過嗎?
power電力
fix修理
dangerous危險的
help幫忙

quiz.question: 1. Where is electricity made?
2. How big was Aaron's electric shock?
3. What did Aaron see in his selfie?

content.en: Do you remember the astronaut who got stuck in space? Dr. Rubio was stuck in space for 371 days. What did he do there?
content.tw: 你還記得被困在太空的Rubio博士嗎? 他被困在那裡371天，都做了什麼呢?

content.en: When astronauts go to space, they do a lot of work. They study. They repair things. And they do experiments - which means trying new things!
content.tw: 太空人在外太空需要做很多的工作。他們讀書、修理東西、還會做實驗!

content.en: Dr. Rubio wanted to try something new. He tried to grow a tomato in space! And he did it! He grew the first tomato in space!
content.tw: Rubio博士試著在外太空種番茄，他在外太空種出第一顆番茄!

content.en: This tomato was very special. Everyone was excited about it. But then... Dr. Rubio lost the tomato!
content.tw: 這個番茄很特別。每個人都很期待，但是Rubio博士把它弄丟了!

content.en: Dr. Rubio looked for the tomato. But it wasn't anywhere. How strange! Some people said maybe Dr. Rubio ate it. But he said he didn't eat it.
content.tw: Rubio博士到處都找不到他的番茄，有人說被他吃掉了，但是他說他沒有。

content.en: Months and months later, Dr. Rubio went back to Earth. Then one day, some astronauts found the tomato in the spaceship! They said, "Dr. Rubio didn't eat it! We found it!"
content.tw: 幾個月之後,Rubio 都回地球了,有人在太空站上找到了那顆番茄,證明Rubio確實沒有吃它。

content.en: The tomato may not be good for dinner anymore. Nobody wants to eat it! But the astronauts are happy. They finally found the lost tomato in space!
content.tw: 這個番茄可能不能再當晚餐了。沒人想吃它！但太空人們很高興。他們終於在太空中找到了這顆失蹤的番茄！

vocabulary.preface: 太空站上消失的番茄，過了好久才找到。

content.text:
1. stuck 受困
Jane, you won't believe what happened to me yesterday.
你不會相信昨天我發生了什麼事!
I got stuck in an elevator for an hour! 我困在電梯裡一個鐘頭!
No way! What did you do? 不會吧! 那你怎麼辦?

2. do 做
What could I do? 我能做什麼?
I called 119.我打電話給119。
But it was no use. 但是沒有用。

3. repair 修理
Why not? 為什麼沒用?
They could at least tell someone to repair it.他們至少可以告訴人去修理。
No, because I was stuck in the basement! 沒有，因為我被困在地下室。

4. finally 最後
So there was no signal? 所以沒有訊號?
Right. Finally it was my dog that saved me.對，最後是我的狗救了我。
How? 怎麼救的?
He kept barking at the elevator doors. 他一直對著電梯門叫。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字你記住了嗎?
stuck受困
do做
repair修理
finally最後

quiz.question: 1. Why did Dr. Rubio grow the tomato in space?
options: a. He was stuck in space.
c. He was trying something new.

quiz.question: 2. Who found the tomato?
3. Where was the tomato found?
